com.xmlmind.ditac.convert
Class ImageCopier

java.lang.Object
  com.xmlmind.ditac.convert.ImageCopier
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageHandler
public class ImageCopier
extends Object
implements ImageHandler

An implementation of ImageHandler which simply copies its image arguments to the directory specified in its parameter string.

For example, if parseParameters(java.lang.String) has been invoked with a "graphics" argument, handleImage("file:/home/john/doc/img/logo.png", "/tmp", console) copies logo.png to /tmp/graphics and returns "graphics/logo.png".

reset

public void reset()
Description copied from interface: ImageHandler
Reset the internal state of this ImageHandler. Invoked by the PreProcessor before a run. Allows the PreProcessor to reuse the same ImageHandler to process several documents.

Specified by:
reset in interface ImageHandler

handleImage

public String handleImage(URL imageURL,
                          File outDir,
                          Console console)
                   throws Exception
Description copied from interface: ImageHandler
Process specified image.

Specified by:
handleImage in interface ImageHandler
Parameters:
imageURL - The URL of the image to be processed
outDir - The directory where the input image, as is or modified, is to be copied
console - Console on which progress, trace, debug, etc, message can be displayed. May be null.
Returns:
The properly escaped, relative to outDir, URL of the processed image.

Return null if default processing is to take place. The default processing does nothing at all and returns imageURL.toExternalForm(). This means that the deliverable will point to the images referenced in the source document.

Throws:
Exception - if, for any reason, this operation fails
